subject: Re: [junit] Testing abstract classes
msgSnippet: ... Every abstract class is equivalent to a concrete class plus an interface, so no, there isn t much difference, except in how you instantiate the object
messageBody:
Stephen Smith wrote:
>
>
> Is there much difference between writing a test for an interface and
> writing a test for an abstract class?
>
> For example, writing a test for Map and writing a test for
> AbstractMap... you write your test methods, and use the Template Method
> patternt to decorate your TestCase#setUp with your implementation.
>
> I've tested abstract classes and interfaces in this manner before, and
> rarely had few complaints.

Every abstract class is equivalent to a concrete class plus an
interface, so no, there isn't much difference, except in how you
instantiate the object under test.
